metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43975 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel through 5.15.2, hw_atl_utils_fw_rpc_wait indrivers/net/ethernet/aquantia/atlantic/hw_atl/hw_atl_utils.c allows anattacker (who can introduce a crafted device) to trigger an out-of-boundswrite via a crafted length value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43975` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
